description:
Always nice coming in here. Because of the location, service is fast and surprisingly friendly. There was a long line out the door, it was actually a hot day in sf.

Toppings aren't really necessary and cost about $2 extra. I recommend getting the froyo by itself. Large is a must if your sharing with another person. My favorite is the pomegranate and don't be shy to ask for a sample!
author: Lynn C.

description:
I've had froyo many times but wanted to try Pinkberry since they were the OGs of frozen yogurt. 

I still like their regular flavor the best in comparison to other places. It's the perfect balance of sweet and tart with the right texture where other places can be a bit too icy. It's too bad that this location didn't have self serve where you pay by the ounce. It's okay though because the froyo is that good by itself. 

Pinkberry, I hope you expand and offer more than one location in Chicago.
author: Pari P.

description:
Dude, there can be no finer place to enjoy a quick refreshing cup of frozen yogurt then the benign and ever pastel kingdom of Pink Berry. 

Either this or what? Go to one of those artisan shops nearby and get a $10 cup of shit they tell me they made from a cow they knew back in college? The price is right, id rather just keep it simple.

Sometimes I feel like their fruit tastes better than other fruit, like they've somehow managed to find the best versions of every fruit I eat. Can I just buy your fruit? Dem raspburreez r fine yo. So fine...

I try my hardest to tell my girlfriend that you can't have a frozen yogurt for a healthy breakfast and put cheesecake on it, but she finds a way to convince me otherwise. 

Now they have tea?! Hwat.

Keep it classy berry p.
author: John W.

description: 1 picture worth 1000 words.........how can pinkberry staff be okay with this? I wonder what do their frozen yogurt and toppings have that we can't actually see
author: Lara S.

description:
Pinkberry! A thowback to my Cambridge, MA days with the Pinkberry just outside the subway station in Harvard Square. Anyway, I digress....

Unlike most of the other froyo spots in the city, you do have to ask the staff for samples, and they don't have as many flavors as the other spots, but choice paralysis is a real thing. I sampled the pomegranate, meyer lemon, and mango flavors. The pomegranate flavor wasn't that prominent, so it ended up being more of a slightly fruity tart. Lemon flavors done well are amazing-- lemon flavors done poorly taste like cleaning supplies. While this wasn't in the latter camp, I wasn't too sold on it. The mango was refreshingly standard. 

Just as I remember, the tart flavor is slightly sweet, and very refreshing. I'd reckon that a small with 2 flavors is enough for 2 people to share-- if you get a small with 1 flavor only, you definitely end up with less! Pro tip!
author: Nicole H.

description: This is really a 3.5. Not a ton of yogurt choices but it's clean in there and the yogurt was fresh. Good gluten free options too. Very small seating area. We went somewhere else the rest of the nights we were in San Fran.
author: Ben T.

description:
I hadn't had Pinkberry in many years, and I had never really been a big fan of it (I preferred more customizable froyo places), but I recently had it again when we visited SF in May 2017 and loved it (sometimes less customization is better for quality, as counterintuitive as that may seem).  We were staying in Union Square and were craving a sweet snack, so we found a Pinkberry location and decided to get some.  I got the plain tart yogurt with strawberries, cheesecake bits, mochi balls, blueberried, and tapioca balls.  We took our froyo to-go and ate it at our hotel nearby.  It was a perfect afternoon snack as we rested in between activities on our trip.  

It was so good that we had it as a snack the next day as well!  I think I'm finally a huge fan of Pinkberry now, years after the froyo craze waxed and then waned.
author: Pegah Y.

description:
I'm a big fan of Pinkberry's chocolate hazelnut flavor - it's the only flavor I get! This location is okay, the workers weren't the friendliest which put a damper on my visit. I'm a huge fan of cookie dough toppings and I was disappointed to see that the cookie dough quality has changed again, they're no longer peanut sized and circular, but they're even smaller and shaped kind of odd, like a flattened pill. It didn't taste like anything at all, not chocolate, and definitely not like cookie dough. I don't recommend getting the cookie dough topping here, I hope they change it back to what they had before. 

The fruits were fresh and the mochi wasn't hard, which is good. But I do feel like it's overpriced for what I got. I had the smallest size with four toppings and the total was $5.25. I'm not sure if they raised the price recently but you can definitely get a bigger cup of yogurt with more toppings for the same price elsewhere.  And probably a smile from the worker too.
author: Cecille W.

description:
Love Pinkberry! Favorite fro yo place out of all them. 

Chocolate hazelnut w/ granola, blueberries, and mochi is my go to. I always end up leaving with a couple more cups for friends to enjoy wherever I'm going. They're nice enough to put to go orders in a bag with an ice pack.
author: Christine B.

description:
The coconut fro-yo was delicious as usual, but I agree with previous reviews that have mentioned that they stiff you on the portions. Though vertically it wasn't lacking, the cup was only about half full. I requested extra toppings to fill it up, so in the end it contained more berries and nuts that actual frozen yogurt. Boooo.

The place was hard to find, and our search for it was rather comical. We at first assumed it was in the mall because of the signs, and wandered through several stories of a department store before being led outside by a helpful makeup clerk.

Overall, yeah, I'll probably go back, but it wasn't the best location I've been to.
author: Ellery D.

description:
I've only had Pinkberry maybe a couple of times in my life.  This was actually surprisingly good.

I got a small tart with blueberries and almonds.  It was a solid portion despite being over $5.  The thing I liked most was that the tart was not exceedingly sour, there was a nice sweet/tart balance.

This location is right in the middle of Union Square so it's really meant to be a grab-and-go kind of thing.  There are I think 5 or 6 stools inside and maybe a couple of small tables outside.
author: Brent T.

description: It's yo standard froyo place (or in my lactose-free case, sorbet). Quick, no hassle, feel good dessert, with tons of topping options (the limit also stops you from going overboard unlike at Menchie's). For a small, you can get up to four toppings, which is more than enough.
author: Kevin N.

description:
I've visited this location twice and my advice is go for one flavor or a swirl of two! During both visits I've chosen my favorite chocolate hazelnut and dairy free coconut side by side in a small cup. First visit was a real downer cuz the yogurt quantity was lacking so much the toppings practically leveled out the cup's top! I had never been so disappointed; I frequent Santana Row's Pinkberry every once in a while and they never lack in serving size. The second visit was better and my yogurt swirler piled on a reasonable amount of toppings. 

My fam only gets one flavor in their cups and there's yogurt swirled at least 2" past the rim, at least for a medium. Love their waffle cookies! Pink always has fresh cut fruit and there's watermelon in winter! Gotta have those blueberries too. 

Friendly service and they gave me a new tangible rewards card since my mobile app no longer works. 
Buy 10 get 1 free and free small with toppings during your birthday month!

Located next to Boudin on O'Farrell and Powell, part of women's Macy's. Indoor and outdoor seating provided, grab one of the four stools with window view to the right for people watching!
author: Kristine F.

description:
Drove by and just had to get me some pinkberry!
I only get pinkberry in LA, so I'm glad there's a pinkberry in SF. It was definitely refreshing as always. Original tart & pomegranate swirl please!
author: Lucy L.

description:
I consider myself a Pinkberry fan. I don't partake of dairy, and their coconut milk coconut soft serve is what vegan dreams are made of. Oddly, my current city of residency houses a Pinkberry corporate office, but no Pinkberry stores. (What gives, people?!!) When I booked my ticket to Oakland last October, one thing I had my heart set on was visiting the Pinkberry store in San Francisco. Whether someone has known me for a day or a decade, the one thing that they can say about me is that I take my food VERY seriously. So excuse me while I go drama queen on this review. [Friend: Could you be any more dramatic?  Me: Hold my gluten-free Voss.]

It was a busy graduation weekend. On my last day in the city, we took a ferry, a bus, then a Lyft to get to this Pinkberry. I hopped out of the Lyft, hands flailing like Mary Tyler-Moore, cheesing like a Cheshire; I was uber excited to be here. I entered the store, ready to order by the pint. As I waited in line, I glanced at their flavor board to my right, even though I already knew what I wanted. I did a double-take. I cock-tilted my head like a confused puppy. My eyes focused, shifted, then glowered. The joyous sparkle in my eyes dissipated into a fuming glare. Original, Power Berry, Chocolate Hazelnut, Pomegranate, Pineapple, and Pinkie's Strawberry; these were the 6 available flavors posted on their wall.  None of them (not a single one) was dairy-free or vegan-friendly. I've been to many Pinkberry locations across the country and every one has had at least one non-dairy flavor in their daily rotation. Surely, the mistake was mine. I re-read the flavor list 5 more times, each time a little slower than the previous. The results never changed. My head snapped 90 degrees toward the soft serve dispensers. I desperately counted: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9...a hope-filled attempt at turning water into wine, or in this case, inner-tears into vegan soft serve. But nope. There were only enough dispensers for the six dairy-ridden flavors and their swirled concoctions.  In vain, I made one last plea to the froyo gods. I asked the employees if they had any non-dairy options. They were indifferent to the pain with which I had been afflicted as they each offered up a simultaneous shrug and head shake. They could not have cared any less about the great lengths to which I had gone to get here, or how I had been salivating for months over their coconut milk coconut only to be devastatingly crushed by someone's brash decision to carry no vegan options even though this location's dedicated website specifically states that the coconut milk coconut is swirling daily. DAILY. DAILY? Just not on the day that I decide to take the trek across Westeros to get it! In shock and disbelief, I stood in the middle of the store contemplating my life. What was I to do? WWJD?  Nothing. Nothing that I nor Jon Snow did would bring me my precious. So I reined in my lividness, grabbed the store manager's card from an employee who was dismissive of my visible distress, and pivot-sashayed out that door, vowing never to return again.
author: Tigra C.

description:
SELECTION
Great overall selection - I think the waffle cone and frozen yogurt with two toppings is a bit much though, to be honest. The staff there seemed like he had a difficult time trying to add the toppings on to my cone. I think ONE reasonable topping is fine, trying to add blueberries and strawberries? Eh...kinda difficult there.

CUSTOMER SERVICE
Awesome and friendly! Thank you guys. =D

ATMOSPHERE
Chill, good vibes. They had an extra seating room which is awesome for big groups.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
I wanted to get the new low fat milk ice cream w/ honey comb like the picture, but the ice cream is Melty when I tried it and the girl said that's how it is.  Bogus picture!

So I got Original Froyo in a Cone and they don't have Honeycomb, only regular honey.  That's bogus but I said ok.  It's super sticky and drippy honey so I don't recommend it.

I had a giftcard so no money on my end.  Think it was like $3 or so.
author: Ann L.

description:
Pinkberry will always remind me of good times in high school. Sadly, Menchie's replaced the one in San Ramon. This location's tiny.

My fave is the tart! I got a mini with dark chocolate crisps, kiwi and blueberries. Mini with toppings is $3.65. They don't put the mini cups out front so people forget or don't know that there's a size smaller than small! 

Scan your Pinkberry app when you pay so you earn points. Free froyo after 10 purchases and on your birthday!

I was here with my 2 good high school friends at 8:30pm on Monday. While we loved our froyo, service was a bit off. My friend was skipped over in line and her chair was knocked into by an employee coming out of their back office room. But he went into that room knowing that she was already there...
author: Melissa W.

description: This is the first time that I have been to a pinkberry.  I have to say that I have walked across pinkberry many times in different locations and I have never tried it once.  This was a hot saturday in the city so I decided to try it.  I ordered the strawberry and also mango and had a strawberry and kiwi topping.   It was really good especially on a hot day.  The yogurt has a tart tast.  If I am in the area I will for sure stop by for Pinkberry.  Price point is about 5 bucks per yogurt if you get some toppings.  Overall, pretty good yogurt!
author: Alice T.

description: Agh what to do when you just have that craving for that classic bit of tartness from Pinkberry?! You make your way there even if that means traveling across the bridge and scouring for parking around Union Square ... because no other froyo is quite the same! As one of the few last Pinkberry locations left in the Bay, this place needs to stay. The staff is friendly and there is a good amount of seating (inside and outside) considering its city location. Pinkberry froyo is still superb and the topping are always fresh. I know the prices are a bit more steep than other establishments where you pay per oz, but the quality is higher. Also, you do get your choice of up to 4 toppings for the small/med sizes. Surely more choices if you opt for a larger container. This location is right by Macy's on O'Farrell St.
author: Michelle H.

description:
If you didn't know, there's a size smaller than small- mini. Get that one! I love the hazelnut chocolate one. They recently got a coconut milk froyo which is okay, I wasn't a huge fan of it but I still like the chocolate hazelnut- which is pretty special to me. I don't think I've been to any location that had that flavor. Maybe yogurtland has it on occasion, but it's never common. I like the milk chocolate crunch- tastes like melted Crunch bar. The chocolate chip is also good. 

Fast service, they have an app that you can download and plenty of good things to try. I still think yogurtland is better- I think it's because I like the whole DIY aspect to it.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Such a convenient froyo place! Located right in Union Square. This place is perfect to go to to take a break from shopping and just sit down and enjoy some goodness. 

My absolute favorite is the original flavor with only two toppings: melted crunch and melted Nutella. Melted chocolate on froyo? YES PLEASE!! 

Although it is a small place, they have 4 bar like seats indoor and a good amount of patio seats. If you get lucky and get a seat inside, it's great to sit in and enjoy a froyo break from shopping and people watch :)
author: Amanda R.

description: Lol my cousin works here and I can't even get a discount. Love Pinkberry! I wish they had Pinkberry in more locations this seems to be the only one in San Francisco. The frozen yogurt is very fresh and love the berry toppings that come with it.
author: Russell T.

description:
So long as Pinkberry keeps offering up dairy free deliciousness in the form of Coconut Milk Swirl, I'll remain a fan, seeking it out wherever there is a Pinkberry location. This is the easiest to get to location for me since we always seem to be at Macy's lately. Being in Union Square, it's also BART accessible which is a big plus for me. 

It's the tiniest of shops that you can possibly manage with a few seats outside. Don't plan on spending much time here beyond what it takes to place your order.

What was different for me was that you pay by size and not by weight which is different from many of the other froyo chains. Since the folks serve it up to you instead of going the self serve route, you can easily get a large size in a medium, as well as get screwed by ordering a large, yet only getting a medium amount of froyo. Overall it kinda works and the prices aren't too shabby. Especially for this touristville downtown shopping area.

The Coconut Milk Swirl is pretty much just that. It tastes like sweetened coconut milk that's been chilled and swirled into a soft serve consistency. I'm sure there's plenty of mystery ingredients but it tastes plenty refreshing, yet with some substance unlike sorbet style froyo. It's listed as Vegan on their website so I'll take their word for it. I'm not a huge fan of fruit based froyo so this is a great alternative for Vegan folk that are looking to indulge just like everyone else.

This was the creamiest of the Vegan froyos that I've tried so far. It would be amazing to see what they can do with the base coconut milk flavor and hopefully expand to coffee, chocolate, etc. For now, I'll be satisfied with a cup of this with fresh berries, and of course you gotta throw in some mochi and popping boba to top it off properly.
author: John B.

description: This review is not against the company or the customer service. The reason for this review is because I am not a big fan of how the ice cream tasted. If I want ice cream, I will go to a place that has real ice cream not not low-fat ice cream. If you like low fat ice cream, then pink berry is the place for you. If you like " regular" ice cream, then I would recommend another place.
author: Terence W.

description:
Tried Peach Passion.Tirned out to be sorbet.Probably for people who don't like yogurt.

I'd rather Stick to the original.
author: Priyanka L.

description:
I love cocktails with a list of ingredients that run across the page. But when it comes to my froyo? I go with something simple.  

You can have the sea salt with chocolate and chopped Heath bars or the passionfruit mango with white chocolate chips. I love the original flavor: tart and refreshing, simply adorned with strawberries and raspberries. If I'm up for a little excitement, I add chocolate curls to it. 

Pinkberry also keeps the payment system stress free: a flat price depending on the size you get, irregardless of what toppings. Not by weight nor topping or worse, give me your first born in exchange for this. Thank you Pinkberry for keeping it real.
author: Janice C.

description: You can never really go wrong with frozen yogurt. This location gets surprisingly busy but the staff is still really friendly and keeps things clean and tidy. I had a small coconut with mochi topping the other night and it was perfect. Coconut dream and the mochi didn't get all hard and frozen from being on the cold yogurt. It was great. I'm not exactly sure how pricing works. We ordered a small with mochi topping and a medium with melted crunch bar on it and it was $10.40. No idea what cost what except I was told the melted crunch bar was 50 cents extra. It was a good reminder that I love frozen yogurt.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Pinkberry is a nostalgic place for me. Good memories of hitting up a location near my apartment as a newlywed. 

Can't go wrong with the plain tart. It is clean and fresh and not too sweet. The perfect canvas for toppings. I always keep it simple with fresh fruit - strawberries, mango, and coconut. Yummy! 

A little on the pricey side. 

This location is small, tight inside, but on a busy street in Union Square, so makes sense. Grab it and eat while walking.
author: Elise H.

description: I adore pinkberry, if I could eat here everyday without turning into a blimp; I would. I love all the flavors but the standouts for me are the cookies and cream, hazelnut, chocolate, and the original tart. I also like to go crazy on the toppings and I love that they have Nutella as an option.
author: Beth G.

description:
After a disappointing visit at a ice cream shop and finding out that Beard Papa's was closed (despite saying they were open on yelp), we ended up walking over to Pinkberry.

Service was slightly on the ruder side but nothing horrible. The prices were high for froyo, which was expected for Pinkberry. However, the place was relatively empty around 8:30PM which was nice.

In the bright side, their froyo was light and definitely tasted clean! Loved it but for the price paid, wish they were more generous.
author: Carlin T.

description:
Oldie but goodie. I'm normally more of an ice cream person but every now and then I'll want tart frozen yogurt.

This place is rarely crowded which is a plus. Of the 5+ times I've been it has been clean, yogurt and toppings are always tasty and service is friendly and fast! In my opinion a small is sufficient for one person.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I've bookmark this place for quite a long. The first time i had pinkberry was when i visit my brother in LA few years back. Now i finally take this place off my to go place in yelp. My mom and i was craving ice cream/something cold after dinner since it was such a nice warm night in sf when i came here few weeks ago. We were thinking to eat ice cream at the restaurant but i told my mom that i know a frozen yogurt place close by so we decided to go this place instead.

This frozen yogurt is not self serve.

When we got here, there was a line. But we didnt wait that long to order our frozen yogurt. Plus this place isnt that spacious especially when it get crowded and long line but the place is very clean. Got the small size of the original flavor with toppings such strawberry, mango, and captain crunch cereal for 4.95. The original flavor has that tart, tangy, sour flavor. The toppings that i had goes well with the yogurt. It was nice to end our night with the frozen yogurt.
author: Julie N.

description:
Although there are so many new froyo places everywhere you go, I must admit that this is still my absolute favorite with yogurtland following behind. 

The first time that I came to this place, I was a little confused by all the chaos and cause I didn't know how to order. But it was fairly easy, where you just basically pick a cut size, your favorite froyo and toppings in order down the line. Pretty simple and fairly priced.
author: Shirley G.

description:
Always get a yogurt parfait. It's the same price as a small with toppings. For the parfait you get to choose your flavors, 3 wet items (fruits), and 1 dry item. I normally in this order from bottom to top get an original tart yogurt, 2 fruit (mango and strawberries), pomegranate tart yogurt, blueberries & honey granola, and topped with original tart yogurt.

Be sure to get a pinkberry loyalty card!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Meh.
Pretty standard frozen yoghurt place, with some seating, haven't got a chance of sitting if it's busy though!
author: Ruth P.

description: Lousy store provided half fill when I ordered a large size. I asked the clerk she said she can't do anything about it. Avoid the tourist trap!!!
author: Sam K.

description: I love pink berry their fro yos are so yummy my favorite by far is the coconut and the hazelnut chocolate and a must have is the melted chocolate crunch sauce!
author: Rita A.

description:
Abigail was really nice and gave us great recommendations. 

I love Pinkberry!!! Better than yogurt land, Menchies, etc.

Their original tart flavor is really tarty if you like that. Also, I love the consistency of the yogurt here- it's thick and creamy and very smooth. You can't find that elsewhere! 

My favorite fro-yo place! Great service and great taste :)
author: Alicia L.

description: Well, my first time here, but I didn't think it was that good that I would come back again. I see that it is a clean and well lighted place, and they do refill all their ingredients promptly. Their fruit toppings looked really good. There is always a line. I thought $4.95 for a small cup was a bit pricy especially, if I were just getting a plain yogurt with no topping. I know it is great for people who likes to pile on toppings, but that's not for me. I prefer Nubi better where they weigh the container and I can pick my own toppings. I like the texture and coldness of the yogurt better. Plus, Nubi has coupons once in a while.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Before you say anything...I already know what you're thinking.  The frozen yogurt craze started a while ago, and I'm only trying Pinkberry now?  Yes, it's true...and so sad.  And yet, it could be worse.  I mean, I never got around to trying Red Mango either.  Ha!

Since we had sneaked in right before they were about to close, I didn't really get a chance to see what flavors they had to offer.  However, what I did see was that they had a Lychee frozen yogurt...done!  After topping it off with Mochi and Chocolate Wafers (essentially like the Pirouette cookies from Pepperidge Farms), my friends and I were off and on our way.  In and out in five minutes?  Not too shabby!

Despite it being a fairly frigid night in SF (surprise, surprise), my frozen yogurt was just about perfect!  The yogurt had a nice, creamy consistency and the lychee flavor was just right - strong enough to taste, but not so strong as to be disgusting.  I could go either way with getting the Chocolate Wafers again, but the mochi is practically a must get topping.  So good!

Although I've yet to try any of their other flavors, I can easily see why Pinkberry is so popular!  The only knocks I could come up with is the fact they aren't closer to me and that they're too good.  Seriously - it just makes me feel that much worse I didn't try them sooner. Man, what the hell Mike?
author: Mike L.

description:
I loved my blueberry frozen yogurt topped with super fresh fruits: mango, raspberries and cookie dough. You can pick as many flavors that will fit in your cup, usually 4.
I had a good amount of everything, the staff was generous :-D

The cookie dough is probably one of the best I've had at a FroYo place because like the fruits, it tasted soo fresh - almost just made (which I doubt!). In other places, it often tastes super industrial and bland.

I tried a sample of the chocolate/hazelnut tart and it was quite flavorful as well.

Staff was patient when we were hesitating on toppings. 

The small-sized cup is already quite big and enough for an afternoon snack.
The bill for 2 of those was about 9 dollars (standard FroYo price!). 

Great place to discover, after all that I had heard about it. I will be happy to return soon!
author: Leslie S.

description: My favorite place to get ice cream/frozen yogurt it's soo good. I usually get the original yogurt with strawberries and yogurt pieces. I would come here everyday if I can!!
author: Natalie T.

description:
When I think of Froyo, I think of PINK BERRY! 

Please add the melted chocolate crunch balls to your cup! This is the best topping ever, if I could order these alone I would. Maybe I can... Never tried. But top these on some chocolate hazelnut Froyo.... Mmmmm!!!

Anyways, this union square location is tiny, with barely any room to sit. Only a few stools and a couple outside chairs. It's perfect for being in SF though! Definitely stop by. The crew is pretty friendly too!
author: Stephanie D.

description: Well...my first visit and I'm giving this place a perfect score. Andrew and Morree were fantastic. They were very patient and extremely helpful. After spilling my cup on the counter, they made me another cup with no hesitation. Oh...did I mention the coconut fruit cup was amazing. Everything was clean, fresh and tasted wondeful. I ordered a small cup and was amazed at the size and flavors. It's hard to imagine coming back a second time and having a less than perfect experience. Some places are built for perfection. This is one of those places.
author: Myron N.

description:
The wife is now hooked on PinkBerry thanks to this trip. She had never had it before and has now fallen in love with the chocolate hazelnut with the fruity pebbles. 

I have had PB before and I love the fresh fruits and their original tart yogurt, it is  a nice mixture of flavors. We still asked to try a few flavors just to make sure we had the ones we wanted, no real issue at first with

This PB is pretty small, but at the same time the one closer to us is just in a mall so it was cool seeing a "real" PB. We won't lie, we did get a little turned around trying to find it while visiting Union Square, felt a little hidden with the construction and everything going on.

The staff was pretty nice overall, one guy spotted my Jacksonville Jaguars hat and made some small talk. However one other guy didn't seem like he really wanted to wait for us to decide what we wanted(considering my wife had never had PB until now, she didn't know what toppings or flavors she was looking for) but minus this one guy our experience was pretty good overall.

Thankfully it was a nice night so we sat outside at their little patio/chairs area and watched people walk by, the inside we believe had a little section to sit at but looked like someone else beat us to it.

Either way, with the little issues we had the wife loves it(as do I) so we will make time to come back the next time we visit SF.
author: John C.

description:
How I've waited this long to try Pinkberry... well, that's become another one of life's great unsolved mysteries. Dropping by several months back, and only because all the other, closer froyo shops had closed already, I sampled a few of their flavors and settled on their original, and their sea salt chocolate.

Without too buildup, the former was tasty, and the latter was frickin' delicious. While they're not as creamy as say, Yogurtland, they're definitely more on the creamy end of the spectrum than the icy end.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A small, multilevel shop. The main level, where you actually order the froyo, is ground level, and totally accessible, while the other half of the store is up one or two steps.

Bathroom - Didn't try them, so no comment.
author: Johnny W.

description: My all time favorite place to get soft serve ice cream(yogurt) love everything especially the mango flavor with pineapples and strawberries!!!
author: CJ L.

description:
Pinkberry has opened their 200th shop in San Francisco's Union Square; located right below the lady side of Macy's on O' Farrell Street. 

"It is about freakin' time that Pinkberry finally arrive to San Francisco. Why took them so long?"

There should've been a Pinkberry shop in San Fran when Bush was president- "George H.W. Bush!"

I don't know if frozen yogurt was a huge trend back then, unlike now.

The shop is busy with six different flavors to choose from. 

I came here and checked-in twice within the same week. My first visit, I had a small Peanut Butter flavor ($4.95) with two toppings including one premium topping for an extra $.50. I was first introduced to the Peanut Butter flavor when I was in San Diego and I loved that damn flavor. But I was surprised that the exclusive flavor was served in the summer at the new shop. I had crumbled almond roca candy and PB toffee (exclusive topping for extra $.50) with PB fro-yo. I couldn't tell you what a memorable first visit to the SF shop. I love the treat. My first treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/I-2sRRTxnKqjozpPMhR8lQ?select=bghx9WfbItRxvFCtpQhfYw#sIKWjhaAC_jvZtNy1IkwxQ

My second visit, I ordered an Original tart and Strawberry flavor in a medium cup (I was hungry after my run). I also added chopped strawberries and a waffle cookie with my treat. Strawberry is a popular fruit in the summer. But my chopped fruit was still frozen. I don't know what to say. But I still love Pinkberry's version of Original Tart. Nice and creamy is perfected by the company. My second treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/I-2sRRTxnKqjozpPMhR8lQ?select=lSQAoLyYmDaPIWfrJ2tYLw#RZHlSpPc124AgHojTz5j6A

Don't forget to get your stamped card-buy 10, get the 11th free. 

Now I don't need to go to the Peninsula or San Diego to get my Pinkberry frozen treat. 

The new Pinkberry is now a big hit in San Francisco. I hope more Pinkberry locations will expand in the city!
author: Matt G.

description:
My excitement over a Pinkberry in SF is somewhere lost in the wayback machine since it's taken well over seven years for the ballyhooed, LA-based froyo chain to make it within our city limits. That's a long time coming in froyo years, which go by so much faster than even dog years. In the meantime, so many mini-chains have popped up serving tasty froyo that I haven't felt a recent hankering for Pinkberry, everybody's Rosetta Stone for such treats. I am reminded of the scene in "All About Eve" when critic Addison DeWitt told aging diva Margo Channing that rising actress Eve Harrington was full of fire and music just like her back in the day. Margo's response? "Yes, that's me - an old kazoo with some sparklers."

The Pinkberry at Union Square is a bit like an old kazoo with some sparklers even though it is spanking new. It's also quite small and given that it just opened, intensely crowded with a busy crew of young Asians (or as David Sedaris would call them - "youth in Asia" or more appropriately, "euthanasia") manning the spigots and the little ladles for the multitude of toppings (see photo). Jamie W. and I were overwhelmed by the number of flavors on the board, but he chose smartly with the $3.50 small cup of the Peanut Butter and nothing else. I, on the other hand, went to town and ordered the $4.50 medium cup of Watermelon strewn with chunks of strawberry, mango and pineapple - a calorific cornucopia of tropical madness (see photo). Sure it was good but hardly distinctive anymore. Do I hear a kazoo?

FROYO - 3 stars...creamier than I remembered and certainly tasty enough but frankly not all that memorable
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...clean but really cramped
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...perky youth in Asia like what you see on a propaganda poster
TOTAL - 3 stars...is Pinkberry the La Boulange of the froyo world?
author: Ed U.

description:
Amazing customer service. The girl who was working was very polite and offered us samples before we ordered in case we didn't like the flavor we chose. I got a medium size vanilla bean with fresh strawberries and chocolate crunch. The inside was VERY clean and everything looked freshly cut/made. You should definitely check this place out if you are looking for an affordable delicious snack/dessert :) 

She also gave my brother and I a 50% off coupon if we came back the next day!
author: Justine C.

description: The guy working there (pravat?) grabbed my fingers as he gave me change. This happened today, Tuesday around 1:15pm. Hope management can find a better replacement
author: Xteethx B.

description:
The nice thing is that they have 4 people at the front every time that I've been here and they always make sure to ask me if I want to try any favors when I come in.

Another nice touch is that they have a pitcher of water where you can hydrate yourself after eating.

Pink berry is good not amazing. It hits the spot of you have a froyo craving. my favorite is the Chocolate crunch topping, which just makes the froyo taste much better.
author: Derrick C.

description:
Yogurt is on point here, *snap snap* I have a high tendency to avoid any flavored froyo, so I'm only writing about their original tart. 

What I like about their yogurt is their stiff texture that doesn't melt easily like Yogurtland's. You still get to pick as many toppings as you like, sometimes they carry more varieties such as mango, raspberry, or pomegranate. I'm a big fruit, so I tend to get those toppings rather than the sprinkles, wafer cookies, etc. The fruit toppings are fairly fresh, their kiwis and strawberries are never too ripe. Their store is fairly clean since only the employees there can put the toppings on, so customers don't really make that huge mess. Even though their store is small, they have quite a bit of employees on shift, so don't get scared away if you see a line out the door. 

They have a few tables outside and a standing area to the right of the store. The setup is a bit strange since the cashier is far from the standing area. So if you were to pay for your yogurt and head to the standing area, you either have to exit the store and re-enter or push your way through the people ordering their yogurt. Half the time I just buy it and go, so it doesn't bother me too much.

What I don't really like is the consistency in service. Yea, you get those good days, bad days with the employees like any other place out there. I'm talking about topping placement. It's like making a piece of sculpture so the toppings wouldn't fall back into their bins. Some are more skillful than others and can place more than 5 fruit cubes onto the yogurt cone, but that's a bit tough to see often. If you plan to choose more than 2 toppings of ample amounts, just order one or two sizes up.

Oh and they do have a loyalty program. Free small yogurt when you buy 10 yogurts or for your birthday.
author: Connie C.

description:
At such a crazy busy location, I was highly surprised what great service I received!

The line was out the door when I arrived, but it went by extremely fast, even with people asking to try new flavors. I tried the key lime and decided to pass and go with the original tart flavor. I loved how they will give you as many toppings as you want, as long as it fits in your cup. I usually go for the healthier toppings (i.e. fruit) and was happy to see that this place not only has watermelon, but also that all of the fruit is fresh and not frozen or canned. 

Tip: Ask for honey, it goes great with the original tart! 

Can't wait to come back for a healthy dessert!
author: Anastasia N.

description:
I love Pinkberry.
Used to stand in line for it at the original location in LA on Huntley.
It is pretty different now, but the taste of the original fro-yo is still delicious.
author: Heejin L.

description: I love Pinkberry!!!! If I could give it 10stars I would!!! They have froyo down. There isn't a bad flavor and don't get me started on all the topping options!!! I only wish there was more than one location and that they stayed open later.
author: Car Z.

description: I feel like they've raised the prices since the last time I've been here. The small size with toppings was a total of $5.25 and I didn't think it was really worth it for what I got. Had the black raspberry yogurt with cheesecake bites, mochi, and strawberries. I liked the flavor of the yogurt but it was a bit more runny than usual; it melted by the time I walked up to Union Square. Also, the workers there didn't seem all too friendly or patient. Don't think I'll be coming back.
author: Cindy K.

description:
I am a Pinkberry addict!  

I have to go at least once a week or else I feel very Pinkberry deprived.  This place is so conveniently located right next to Union Square, right under Macy's!  It's a cute little store with not much seating space.  I was so happy to get my double points on cherry-flavored yogurt.  I LOVED IT!  It was absolutely amazing.  It is probably one of the best fruit flavors they have!  Mango and cherry are both really good, but I think they might have taken away mango since cherry just came out!  

On the sad note, I'm still kind of mad at Pinkberry for taking out their BEST FLAVOR YET: chocolate hazelnut.... like why!?!?!?!  That flavor honestly made you cry because it was so good.  Chocolate hazelnut was the best flavor they've ever had, and they replaced it with chocolate.  What.  

At least they offered the cherry flavor now.... but look out cherry lovers, they only keep flavors for a few months!  Go get them cherries! :D
author: Jana L.

description: Delicious and so close to Rincon Hills South Beach. Awesome and clean. Favorite items are the Bolba Pearls in the mango sherbert. Yummy!
author: Kathy S.

description: Just yummy! The service was so nice. Great staff! I came with my student and we are asked to take our time to select our flavor & toppings. Such a nice experience! Will be back again & again.
author: Ria D.

description: Still the best froyo in the city. Their new flavors are always fun to try but their original is still my all time favorite. Not too tart like other other froyo places and not too sweet either. Mochi is the best topping in my humble opinion!
author: Yad L.

description:
This place is located on the corner of Powell and O'Farrell near the Macys store, not to be confused with the Macys Men store a block down. I've been here 4-5 times in the last 2 weeks (yikes) but ish sho gooooood. 

Its froyo, people say its healhier than ice cream but then Pinkberry has some toppings that will go straight through the heart. I always get the chocolate hazlenut here. Its a pretty small location with some tables outside. FYI no bathroom inside.
author: Daanyaal K.

description: Pinkberry's froyo quality can never go  wrong. I love this place, and always get original tart. Their selection of toppings are fairly good and very fresh. I like their cones too. It's far better than Yogurtland quality, but it's not self serve. It's worth having as an occasional cold treat on a warm day. The area is close to Westfield shopping. There is usually a line.
author: Alice S.

description: I love how Pinkberry gives up a ton of topping at one price! I definitely stocked up on my antioxidants for the day: blueberries, blackberries, raspberries, etc. The yogurt wasn't too cloyingly sweet and the location was prime.
author: Jane H.

description:
Finally, Pinkberry in SF!  When I moved to SF in February, I was yelping it and the closest one was at the airport.  Now it's right in downtown on the O'Farrell side of Macy's (the original Macy's not the men's Macy's).  The workers are kind of awkward here since they're all new - but they're all nice and efficient.  5 stars!  There are a lot of workers behind the counter.  And most of them are girls. This location does not have coconut here so I normally get original.  I think these workers are trained to only give or ask about four toppings (e.g. if you ask for three, they'll leave room for one more and ask you about the last topping even if you didn't want one).  There's a standing room inside and outside seating where you can people watch.  

$4.95 is a bit steep but I've gotten used to the prices.  Love Pinkberry!
author: Chris L.

description:
Perfect for a nice warm day in DTSF, especially after shopping for a few hours.
My favorite flavors are Mango, Coconut, and the Original - topped with Mountains of mochi and fresh fruit.
author: Michelle C.

description: Over $5 after tax for a small cup of froyo?! No thank you. I heard great things about Pinkberry, but it was just average to me. Flavor-wise, I prefer the more acidic taste of plain tart yogurt from Yogutrland. The fruit toppings were sparse and some of my berries were frozen. I did appreciate them having both mango and strawberry juicy boba toppings. I'm still a Yogurtland girl at heart and definitely have a high preference towards self-serve froyo stores. I won't be making a second visit here because it is too overpriced.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
I love the lime and mandarin flavors here! U cant find these two flavors at any frozen yogurt place in the city! Very refreshing. Great location-convenient to everything. Outdoor seating. 
Always pleasant encounters with the workers! :)))
author: Anudari K.

description: OBSESSED with this place! Owner & employees are always so nice. Toppings are very generous. Always offering more samples than I need.   I've never had trouble w this place, other than the minimal seating and the tiny little storefront. Love!!
author: Geraldine M.

description: I know this is a chain but I do enjoy a nice original tart with fruit and mochi. I first had pinkberry in la and liked that their froyo was tart and not super sweet. Now that there are froyo places everywhere, I still like pinkberry more than most. Especially in the union square area. Plus I can get ALL their fruit toppings and mochi for the flat price of a small froyo versus paying by topping. Way better deal than some of the other froyo places in union square!
author: Elena N.

description: Other Frozen Yogurt places just don't compare! Pinkberry is my weakness! It's not self-serve which is a huge plus! They were out of pomegranate seeds while I was there though-Tear.
author: Goldie J.

description:
I went in to get my free birthday yogurt. My only annoyance is how small the place is. O'Farrell isn't packed with shoppes and hotels so the street is pretty narrow. There are about 3 small tables outside that's practically in everyone's walkway and inside is not much better.

My treat was really delicious and just enough. Do try the pomegranate yogurt!!!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
My friend and I hit up this Pinkberry every Friday (froyo friday) and always have a great experience. For being in the middle of the city, the prices aren't bad. I think I usually spend between $5 and $6 with a bunch of toppings. 

Overall, pretty good spot. The workers are always real friendly, and offer samples of all the flavors.
author: Nick S.

description: The frozen yogurt was super yummy.  The service was not great.  Not awful, not rude, just kind of bleh.  The yogurt, however, was SOOOOOOO good and refreshing.  I highly recommend the strawberry!
author: B. H.

description:
Love this place. 

The yogurt tastes AMAZING. And they usually have different flavors every once in a while. They make the yogurt look like a masterpiece. It usually comes out so perfect that I don't want to eat it. It's a little pricey for yogurt but it's definitely worth your money.

Workers are super nice and friendly. I asked to try all of the flavors and they did it without hesitation. Definitely my #1 yogurt place.
author: Vernice T.

description: We stopped by Pinkberry after walking to Downtown and shopping at Macy's so it was refreshing to order a yogurt here for a snack break!  They have healthy choices, and will give you a sample to taste.  Although you cannot serve yourself, they do have a variety of toppings for your yogurt!
author: Karen W.

description: I'v been here long time for the original yaourt when the store was just opened. It was really good. I told my friends this is the best in SF. But after today, I'll never come back again, the quality is worse. The yaourt is less milk, more ice and sugar. So disappointed.
author: Jinny N.

description:
(See pics) Review #1309. First time to a Pinkberry and it was a nice experience - palate, visual and feel.

Gingerbread flavor was nice and subtle. Sampled mango which did not taste like mango but was good tart. Original tart flavor was solid. Toppings were fresh and enticing.

Love the very friendly service here and the sampling was more than a small bite size. People actually chatted with you rather than just treating you as a customer. You can tell they were having fun working there.

Very cute and clean setting. Colorful but not over pastel theme. And if you are worried about all the weight gain from it, walk to the side of the eatery and they have a long table against the floor-to-ceiling glass wall where you can stand and enjoy, or sit outside after your Union Square shopping and strolling.
author: T L.

description:
Fantastic frozen yoghurt!

I have been meaning to try Pinkberry out for ages, and today I finally did.

The salted caramel was dreamy, and surprisingly perfect with some blueberries and raspberries sprinkled on top. Next time I think I will work some way more unhealthy topping options, like caramel sauce and chocolate pieces.

My only gripe is that I was a little disappointed that there weren't more yoghurt flavour options.
author: Laura D.

description:
I love me some froyo having a nice dinner :) This one was conveniently located near us and open at 8:30pm...

It's a smaller location near Union Square and because it was 30 minutes before closing time, there weren't too many people here. They had 5 flavors (plain original, strawberry, sea salt chocolate, white raspberry chocolate, and passionfruit). 

We ordered a small with strawberry and passionfruit with kiwi, mochi (GOTTA GET DA MOCHI), and strawberry toppings. 

Can't go wrong with some good ol' frozen yogurt and walking along Union Square at night. HOWEVER, the employees were a bit MEH. I understand that it's close to closing time...but you don't have to look like a skunk just dropped down and died in front of your store. SMILE! :)
author: Rachel C.

description: The girl that helped me was so nice and the yogurt is so good. I tried the chocolate hazelnut but got vanilla bean because I like plain flavors. Their dark chocolate crisp is the best topping.
author: Tammy P.

description: I'm giving this place three stars, and only because of the limited amount of toppings. Otherwise it would be 5 stars! I ordered the medium peach frozen yogurt around $7 and was told I only could choose between 3-4 toppings. I don't like how they make the frozen yogurt for you as I'm used to it being self serve with unlimited toppings, although you pay by the ounce other places. The frozen yogurt and toppings themselves were delicious and fresh I'll give them that. Staff was friendly!I will probably be back, as it might be worth it once a month.
author: Hoku L.

description:
I was very excited to see finally a Pinkberry was opening in Union Square as I have been a lover of their yogurt at Manhattan locations. Went there today for the first time, ordered a cone and was shocked when the gal handed it to me. She could see that I was perplexed and asked me , "Oh do you not want it?". The cone was half full and I asked her if that was all I got and she said "oh do you want more?' and turned and put a little bit more in it. After she put more in the frozen yogurt still didn't even reach the top of the cone. I left feeling totally ripped off and then found a photo of a cone from Pinkberry I had gotten in Manhattan and went back and showed them. The guy said "Well it has 3 oz's and they must have overfilled it" I told him that this is the way I always am given a cone and he said "This one has toppings."

I have never been given such a skimpy portion at any Pinkberry, other Ice cream shop or frozen yogurt shop as this one. Whom ever owns this particular franchise obviously thinks they can give super small portions for the price in their desire to make money. I was totally disappointed and shocked as this has not been my experience at any of the Pinkberrys I have been to in New York. With all of the competition in San Francisco for artisanal Ice Creams and Frozen Yogurts I will surely go elsewhere here in San Francisco and save my desire for Pinkberry for when I am back in NYC.
author: Steven B.

description: Cute shop, wish they had more seating, though. But aside from that, the staff is really accommodating and friendly here! My friends and I wanted to use a buy one, get one 50% off coupon, but it turns out that it wasn't valid yet, but the associate was nice and gave us a half off deal this time anyway. How nice! As usual, Pinkberry is delicious and fulfilled my fruity, sweet tooth.
author: Amanda Y.

description:
Holy Smokes... I think I just found my new obsession.

Peanut Butter Yogurt, with Milk Chocolate Crunch topping. I told my wife it tasted like "sex in my mouth." I'd say that is quite the compliment.

5 stars
author: Joel V.

description: All of the staff were super friendly and helpful when my sister and I visited. I don't usually do samples BUT when offered this new strawberry banana joint, how could a girl resist? The flavor was as "light and airy" as the signage announced and I got the whole thing sprinkled with gummy bears and  those pink popping boba. Yum.
author: Gabrielle T.

description:
Place is pretty good, it's my go to for frozen yogurt. I tend to order from here often with postmates, and they don't seem to have a lot of the flavors but that could be an issue with Postmates.

Love the topping choices as well.
author: Colin G.

description: I just really wanted froyo, and this was the closest place to get it.  Naturally though, given it's right in Union Square, it's a small little place and it's always very busy.  They don't have a lot of flavors, and it's not self-serve, but the froyo was good and the toppings were very fresh.  Probably won't be a favorite spot, but the service and froyo were great.
author: Kristen T.

description:
Yeah I just love all the "Pinkberry," yogurt locations - I mean first of all I like their products especially the frozen strawberry, mango, chocolate, vanilla, & mixed them with sprinkles of chocolates, kisses chocolates, & gummy bears on top of my yogurt is really good right fellas/ladies! LOL. Moreover, their customer service are pretty good on the severs & people that work in all the places I've been to either in San Jose, Los Angeles, & San Francisco locations for Pinkberry are worth it to try to buy their yogurt & order those different flavors & just try it if not your missing out on it y'all, so go buy & eat it. YADIG!

I just love going when I can especially when it's really hot & I want to cook off & just satisfy my craving with something good that is cold, yummy, & healthy fruity flavors of "Frozen Yogurt Pinkberry!" Haha! Well I hope this helps you all decide to try their product & visit their stores or locations near your area where you live folks alright! Take Care Everybody & I hope you all have a nice day, & I wish each one of you the very best & I love eating those frozen yogurt flavors right ladies, since they're very good I ate them myself & it's delicious. YESSIR!
author: Lawrence G.

description: Original tart is perfect just the way it is. I always get a sample of the new seasonal flavor, but end up with the original tart. The service here is great, employees are all very helpful and patient.
author: Meredith L.

description:
Pink berry is good, but not too different than any other yogurt place that offers toppings. It's a nice break in the afternoon if you are shopping in the area. However, it's  not a "destination" yogurt experience. 
One nice touch is that it has pomegranate errols as one of the topping offerings.
author: Robert B.

description:
Pinkberry finally moves its way to SF!!!

If you don't already know, I am an avid Pinkberry fan. I try to get it whenever I'm close by to one. Something about its not too sweet not too tart perfectly swirled consistency that always gets me.

Was having a mother-daughter day and decided to get us each one. The friendly girl outside told me that Pinkberry was having a promotion and if I downloaded the Pinkberry app on my smartphone and registered the account, I would be able to get a free small with toppings. FREE PINKBERRY?! You had me at free, I already love Pinkberry. Unfortunately, my "smartphone" force closed on me before I could even register. I never got my free small with toppings. :( I was surprised my mother liked the frozen yogurt here because she likes to criticize everything I get her.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
Overjoyed that Pinkberry is finally in Union Square - yippee whooppeee!  :)  I have been waiting and waiting for Pinkberry to arrive here.  I've tried all the other fro-yo places in the City, but there is just no topping (there are close seconds) for me the taste of Pinkberry's original flavor, which I most always get with strawberries and pineapple.  

I heard their cup sizes are smaller - I don't care, I always get the Small and it's enough for me.  They say their prices are more - again, I don't care (well, a little, no not really because a Small will always fit in my budget).  They also say the store is small - it's San Francisco and rent must be ridiculous, I completely understand.  

There could be more seating - there are probably rules and regulations about taking over the sidewalk in front of the store, so again, I understand.

I love Pinkberry, am a huge fan -- can I get dibbs in line for saying that?  Thank you.  ;)
author: Maile N.

description:
I will admit, I am not the frozen yogurt type of guy.  But Pinkberry is alright in my book.  The friendly and helpful staff make all the difference.  They will offer you to try as many samples as you like to determine which flavor you want to get.  

After choosing a flavor, they ask you what toppings you want.  They aren't cheap on the toppings either.  Since price is not determined by the weight of the cup, but rather by the size of the cup, I thought they would put only a few toppings here, and a few toppings there.  But, I was wrong.  They piled the toppings sky high and gave us two waffles when we asked.  The only downside to this place during my first visit was the fact that they gave us strawberry instead of watermelon frozen yogurt.  :(
author: Victor L.

description:
SO GLAD there's finally a Pinkberry in SF.

Their flavors, quality of ingredients and service is above the rest. They give you all the toppings you want. No weighing, no extra charge (one flat rate for whatever toppings you want). Just ask, they won't say no to you. Their staff will always take their time with you even when the line is out the door. You can ask for all the samples you want and they won't make you feel bad about it.

Flavors do rotate often. My all time favorite is mango. Try it with coconut and mochi.

Don't forget to ask for a stamp card.
author: Andy W.

description:
All froyo is not created equal. Froyo is now as popular as ice-cream and dipped cone but, the quality varies tremendously.  Now that I have my share of yogurt, I can safely say that my favorite is Pinkberry.

I don't really care for self-service because all I get is the Original/Plain flavor. Pinkberry's original flavor has a slightly sweet flavor that turns into a tartness after the first taste. Texture is smooth and velvety, not too watery and not too "stiff". Usually I get coconut flake, kiwi, pineapple, strawberry and mango for toppings. $4.95 for a medium cup is fair but not cheap. 

They also have fattening toppings like brownie bits, oreo crumbs, mochi, and all sorts of candies. Something for everyone. I have tried Yogurtland, Tutti Fruti and other froyo places but Pinkberry has remained the most consistent.
author: Matt Y.

description:
This is the best Froyo available. 

The service at this and all Pinkberry locations is a step above everybody else. 

The imaginative flavors not only have great names but take your mouth on little flavor vacations. When you see the sign outside, read. "Flavor Vacation"
author: Justin S.

description:
I used to have pinkberry every weekend back 4 years ago when I lived near Victoria Gardens down in SoCal...so glad they finally brought Pinkberry up to the bay not too long ago!!

I always get strawberries and the chocolate milk crunch. Best extra 50 cents I could possibly spend. I always wonder how the rice crispies stay so fresh and crispy in the liquidy chocolate. Either way, om nom nom.
author: Angela L.

description: I know they are well known for their frozen yogurt, being the health freak that I for the most part am I went for the greek yogurt. The greek yogurt was delicious which had a nice sour bite to it. To balance the sourness I went with bananas, cinnamon granola, and cinnamon honey as my toppings. Each provided great balance toward the yogurt while also adding a nice textural variety with each component. The highlight was the honey, however as I could drink the golden liquid out of the bottle. I had two issues, both not related to the yogurt itself. 1. Why does a small cost $5? I mean it is pretty good, but that is a hefty price to pay. 2. Do you really need to weigh my yogurt? You're already making me pay a whole Lincoln! All in all good but expensive!
author: Mitchell L.

description:
Friendly workers!

Love their tart. I normally get a small + unlimited topping (as long as it fits in the cup) for a flat price of $5

If you're on the go, they offer lids as well :)
author: Christina H.

description:
I wish they had more flavors, but overall the chocolate hazelnut is really good. Toppings are good as well. I mean it's pinkberry, you can't go wrong since it's a major chain. You get what you order and what you select!

The location is not bad, it's super small and I wish you can sit in there and eat. I do like their point/card app thing, which is nice and all. I would come back again, hopefully they post flavors on their FB, but I'd like to know what they have.
author: Minerva L.

description: Nice customer service and flavor variety. They let you taste enough to be happy with your choice. A cone is cheaper than a cup. I got a cone costing about $3.00. I'm a chocolate lover so the chocolate hazelnut satisfied me but I also tried grapefruit. It's also a great choice. Tons of topping to choose from if that's your thing
author: Lara H.

description:
My pinkberry obsession continues.  Pinkberry is just the best out of all the frozen yogurt chains.  I always go back to basics and usually don't deviate from the original tart flavor.  I won't say no to a sample though ;)!

The staff is always friendly and I'm happy that there is always fresh fruit! I usually add a sprinkle of  granola or almonds on top. Make sure you get the app and rack up those rewards! I believe you get a free one during your birthday month.
author: Lauren C.

description:
Well, kids, we finally got a pinkberry. 

And wow. Those employees are far farrrr too peppy. 

Small strawberry with raspberries -- automatic go-to now for froyo in SF. It was like eating their signature tart... and at the same time a bit of strawberry yogurt. 

.... This is probably the best yelp review I've ever written, if you read it in mono-tone.
author: Emily D.

description:
The employees here are super friendly, although I came in looking for the Chocolate Berry Greek yogurt, and it doesn't look like it's on the menu anymore (WHY PINKBERRY?!?) and so the employee was very confused by my request. Luckily one of the other workers had been around for a while and still remembered and helped me recreate. Hooray! But I really wish Pinkberry would bring that back. 

Place is clean though, service is prompt and friendly... Overall a good place to stop in for a snack.
author: Christina L.

description: This Pinkberry is perhaps the smallest Pinkberry location I've ever visited. Despite the tiny size, it doesn't disappoint when delivering Pinkberry's yummy goodness! The staff here are very friendly and will greet you upon entering the store, even if they're already helping another customer. Take advantage of the samples, when they offer them (especially when they release a new flavor). Also, don't forget to sign up for Pinkberry's Pinkcard, especially if you are a Pinkberry fan! Since it was my birthday, I was able to get a medium sized Pomegranate froyo for only $1 with my Pinkcard & the birthday special!!!
author: Paulamertha A.

description: The customer service here is absolutely amazing!! They're very generous and give you your money's worth of yogurt :) and it tastes so yummy!
author: Cindy S.

description:
We stop here all the time. It's always great and toppings are fresh.

I like the pomegranate and their plain tart one the most.  I tried pumpkin for my free birthday choice and it was good too!
author: Foodlover B.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE Pinkberry! It is by far my FAVORITE froyo establishment ever! I go to school in Berkeley and was the girl who squealed when I heard free Pinkberry on campus. I always wondered why there wasn't a location closer to Berkeley (other locations are at SFO and Santana Row in SJ).

Last Thursday, I barted to the city because I needed to return something at Neiman Marcus. I am very directionally challenged and got lost walking there from the bart station; luckily my boyfriend came to my rescue. We were walking down O'Farrell when I saw the bright white lights and color scheme that I am oh so familiar with. I immediately ran into the store with the biggest grin on my face and ordered my usual (small original with fruit toppings).

If you're unfamiliar with how Pinkberry works, you first pick a size (S, M, L). Then, if you want to add toppings, you pay a little extra and you are allowed to add as many as you want that'll fit in the cup! Yum. Pinkberry's taste is unmatched by any of its competitors; it is so refreshing and provides just the right amount of tartness that always leaves me wanting more.

This location doesn't disappoint. They apparently stopped doing the physical stamp cards though and have converted to using a mobile app that will allow you to pay with it and keep track of all your purchases.

TIP: Download the free Pinkberry app for your smartphone and you will be given a code for a FREE SMALL WITH TOPPINGS that can be used that same day! I don't know how long this promotion will last for but HURRY AND GO!
author: Ava S.

description: I like the flavors of frozen yogurt they come up with. They change some of the flavors every so often. I like that the employees put the toppings on to help avoid people with nasty hands contaminating the food. I find myself eating this even when the weather is cold or rainy. It just taste good.
author: Chardonnai S.

description:
I love love love Pinkberry! If it moved to Hawaii I would marry it!

Pinkberry is simple and to the point. Yogurt. Shakes. Smoothies. Toppings galore! My favorite is the chocolate banana shake. De-lish!! I bet you usually only get fro-yo at Pinkberry. You're crazy! Try a shake next time!
author: Courtney O.

description: This is the only Pinkberry in the city but it sure is a pain to get to so -1 star for it's location in the middle of everything. If all I am coming to the area for is some froyo, I'll usually park in the Ellis / O'Farrell garage across the street. The employees here are always friendly and never rush new friends that I bring in that don't get the whole froyo thing yet.
author: Leina K.

description:
Great yogurt it's great for snacking and desserts I happen to love getting Nutella on the original flavor and add some strawberry and granola on mine and it's a great place to go when it's nice and hot out or when you just finished from a long days of work at the law firm. ;) also it's a great place to take your kids to get some homework done after school. It is the healthiest fro yo place I've ever seen (when you don't get the sweet toppings) also it's a great place to come for some mid-shopping snacks.

Enjoy some fro yo!!
author: Johnny R.

description: I always pass by here and here I am! Met a friendly man who greeted me at the store and let me sample the coconut frozen yogurt--OMG creamy smooth light coconut taste--got to love it! I'm looking foward this summer with Pinkberry.
author: Jackie T.

description: I asked for another topping because he didnt tell me i could have more, i asked if he could put it on the side and he said no. He is a spanish speaker.
author: Josep Maria R.

description:
I am so happy there is a pinkberry in the city and it is so convenient to get to.  I'm not going to lie, I like frozen yogurt but I always thought frozen yogurt is frozen yogurt, but pinkberry is so delicious it changed my mind.

I love the variety of flavors and fresh toppings they have.  There are a ton of different toppings you can choose from and they will put as much into the cup as long as it fits. They even let you swirl two flavors together.  Also, I enjoy that they have been trying out different flavors depending on the season for extra variety.  Grapefruit was surprisingly delicious.  They recently started doing greek yogurt, which is good, but I hope they don't lose too some of their regular frozen yogurt flavors.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
It's a typical frozen yogurt place that's just as good as most of the others in the downtown area. Pick your flavour of froyo, select toppings that they put on for you, pay and yum on down.

Four stars because they have nutella as a topping option, which I've not see anywhere else yet. I would have tried it but didn't see it until I picked cherry frozen yogurt and didn't think the chocolate would go well with it. Next time I'm by, I'll go for the plain tart flavour with nutella on top!
author: Cassandra J.

description: Everyone who works there looks like they don't want to be there. They are visibly unhappy when you ask them for a shake, maybe because of the extra work of cleaning? I asked them to refill my loyalty card and the girl at the counter asked me "Now?!" and was very hesitant. Seriously? Their stuff is aight tho, just up that service a bit!
author: Shitij A.

description: I really appreciate pinkberry and, in fact, used to work at one in New York. However, I'm really disappointed in the Union Square store because I called to see what time they closed and they said 10. Apparently, their employees aren't aware of their store policies because they closed at 9 tonight which I learned when I showed up, after traveling into the city from the East Bay.
author: Alicia B.

description:
Hands down favorite froyo spot in the city. A close second is Fraiche. 

The service is fabulous, the yogurt is delicious and the consistency is superb. 

My go-to order is the plain tart w/ strawberries, mangoes and mochi. The fruits are always fresh and yummy and  the mochi is always chewy and plump. Yes, I mean plump in a good way. And the yogurt itself has the perfect degree of tartiness - it's not overtly tarty to make you cringe (ahem, Nubi) and it's not completely plain that you can't even feel the tart (ahem, Tuttimelon). 

The location is convenient for a post-shopping treat, pre-shopping indulgence or just a detour from FiDi during the afternoons. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: Pinkberry is popular in LA. I'm glad they have it at SF. I super love how they have different flavors yogurt. They also have seasonal flavors too. They are super generous with the toppings. I usually get a small and they would put like 6 toppings. The fruits r fresh too which is a plus. I know some yogurt place their fruits is not sweet or it has turn bad. The people working there are friendly. They don't rush you.
author: Miri L.

description:
Pretty yummy frozen yogurt shop at Macy's in Union Square.  We visited on a hot fall day, and fro yo was a welcome treat.

Their frozen yogurt is pretty good, with lots of healthy and indulgent toppings to choose from.  I personally prefer the self-serve fro yo shops a la Yogurtland, that have a wider variety of flavours, but can't complain about the quality or service in this shop.
author: Aymie R.

description:
I love the yogurt here! It's great! In my opinion, Pinkberry has the best plain tart flavor. It's a kinda expensive compared to other frozen yogurt places, but it's worth it.

The customer service is great. They're really nice and will let you try whatever you like to figure out what you want to get. 

Whenever I'm downtown, I always leave room to get yogurt here. It's my favorite place to get froyo in SF.
author: Breniel L.

description: Friendly staff, great yogurt, and right outside the Macy's shopping center! What more could you ask for?
author: Isadora Q.

description:
I absolutely love this Pinkberry! The staff is SUPER friendly and patient! 
Delicious tarty yogurt! (Favorites: original and pomegranate or mango- side by side)

Unlimited toppings for one set price! (they even have grapefruit occasionally! Now, that's a total win because we all know how hard it is to scoop out the yummy flesh of a grapefruit)

Granted, it's a little pricey but they reward their customers with stamp cards. Perfect spot for a snack after a long afternoon of shopping! :)
author: Patricia K.

description:
Highlights: 
- 2nd Pinkberry to open aside from the one in Terminal 2 inside SFO! Yay, for not having to purposely fly out of T2 just to ensure I get my Pinkberry fix. :)
- Great spot for a quick refreshment break while shopping downtown. 
- 6 flavors (original is still my favorite), fresh fruit, and premium dry toppings (organic gummies, chocolate crisps, honey roasted sunflower seeds, best granola, etc)
- Free water
-Seating with tables outside

Improvement: 
- Only standing room inside. A few stools would be nice. 

Tip: 
Download their Pinkberry app for their stamp card system. Purchase 10 and get on small frozen yogurt for free (any flavor and toppings).
author: Tracy T.

description:
Pinkberry!  Hell yeah!

Would get five stars except their new location on the backside of Macy's on O'Farrell Street is kind of obscure and it's pretty small.

Other than that, best frozen yogurt.  Ever.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Fivestarberry.

Weather called for smoothies and a parfait. Recently launched nonfat Greek yogurt called for Pinkberry.

Couldn't decide between a honey granola or chocolate granola parfait. So they gave me a sample. Of the entire parfait. Could have stayed here all day.

Go chocolate. Magically healthy. Like Cocoa Puffs for adults.

Smoothie choice was easy. Bananas and strawberries. Sensing the healthy kick gentleman asked if I wanted the sugar. Very observant. Very good. Even without sugar.

Yes it's a chain. Yes it's invading San Francisco. Yes the product and people are five stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
Oh Pinkberry how I've missed you! 

I heard they had opened one up in SF but wasn't sure where it was. I didn't realize how often I passed by it going back and forth from the Powell Bart station! It is sort of hidden, and until I went right up to it I didn't even realize it WAS a Pinkberry. 

A+ for the service (always good about letting you try any flavor you want), the freshness of all the toppings, and their perfect combo of creamy/icy yogurt! I also love that they're now going to have the stamp cards on an app through your phone. So convenient. 

Only downside would be the location (but what can ya do) and the space. I can see how it could get really crowded around there. Plus it sucks that you have to deal with the city stink while eating your yogurt if you're sitting outside.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Can someone hand me my phone? I'd like to report a rape! 

I used to go to Pinkberry twice in a day back when I was squatting in LA in 2007. Back when there was that scandal about them not having enough probiotics to technically be a "frozen yogurt" (because we're all coming to Pinkberry to get healthy, fools!). So don't get me wrong, Pinkberry is creamy and delish...but $4.95 for a small w/ toppings?!?! R-A-P-E! 

Is Pinkberry in the Bay 5 years late on the scene? Yes.
Is Pinkberry raping us? YES.
Is customer service on point? Yes.
Do they have watermelon and mango flavors? Yes.
Did I take a frequent buyer card? Ugh, yes.
Can they legally call what they sell "yogurt"? I sure as hell don't know/ care. 
Will I be back for more? Unfortunately, probably, yes...why do I like the abuse?

MINUS one star for rape.
MINUS one star for super claustrophobic/ hot location.
author: Kristine W.

description:
My must-visit when I am around union square. 

Must:
Original froyo
cookie&cream froyo (available now)
sea salt caramel froyo
Smoothies (made from real yogurt and tons of fruits)

LOVE! Why don't you open in Seattle?
author: Patty T.

description: Best.Froyo.Ever. All their flavors are amazing and they give out free samples :3 service was nice, and i loved how u can get as much topping as u can xD just wish theyd have more toppings to choose from though :(
author: Jenny N.

description:
Every time I come to Pinkberry, I feel like nicole Richie in 2005. 

I love it, although to be honest I hate how they assign a person to you during the ordering process. It's too much for my fragile ego to take. 

My standard order: plain fro-yo, peanut butter chunk (pay the extra it's so good), strawberries, mango, mo-chi, coconut shavings. Take to Macy's and browse LeSportSac bags. You're welcome.
author: Maria D.

description:
I love this frozen yogurt. Particularly the original with the lemon cookie crunch topping. (I think it may have some kind of addictive chemical in it..) 

Why aren't there more in SF?
author: Michael B.

description:
It's good. Don't get me wrong. It IS slightly better than most other froyo places, but it comes with the slight increase in cost. 

The only thing that sometimes makes me cautious to come here is their pep. Yes...they are a bit too much sometimes when I walk in. I don't want to be a hater but I prefer to add my own toppings and do it in peace :)
author: Justin C.

description:
Busyyyy but it's also a block away from Union Square and basically a part of Macy's storefront...  back...  I don't know how to say it, but it was crazy busy.  I'm sure they have died down since the last time I was there (I went a few times when they first opened) but all in all they were a pretty standard froyo place.  

I do like how you can go there and just get a bowl of fruit and their fruit is pretty tasty!
author: Jammir G.

description:
Who doesn't LOVE pinkberry?!

But why does it have to be so far out in the city? Inconvenient location unless you're a tourist staying in the hotels right smack in the middle of Union Square. 

Prices need to be better! Ordered a small thinking it was the smallest size; whopping $5! I can get 2 pints of Ben & Jerry with that price!

Mini is actually their smallest size not small.
author: Keiko C.

description:
Not a big fan of Pinkberry....but this is a new location that opened in SF.  Of course I need to try it.

This location is very clean and bright like any other locations.  The staffs are super friendly and welcome but kinda slow service.  Only two people were in front of me but I waited almost 10 minutes in order for someone to serve me.  

I got the small cup of peanut butter without topping ($3.50).  The flavor was good and creamy.  But the size was kinda small.  I used only three minutes to finish it.

Yogurtland is still my #1!
author: Liza T.

description: Service friendly & froyo okay, but there was a hair in my kiwi.  :( Only 1 hour after they opened.
author: BizzyLizzy K.

description: My weekly treat ... sometimes daily :P Too bad Lychee and cherry are only seasonal but when they have it - topped with chocolate crisps, almond roca and cheesecake bites- HEAVEN!!!!
author: Julie R.

description:
Finally!  I have been waiting a few years for a Pinkberry to open in SF.  In the Bay Area, the only way to get it before was at locations 30+ miles outside of SF or at SFO. Looking forward to the easier access to their frozen yogurt, especially the seasonal flavors. My favorite from the past has been the Salted Caramel. They also have lots of great toppings, including Mochi.  The fresh fruit is always tasty and makes it a bit "healthier" for me, after I add the cookies and candies.
