The space is a bit small, they didn't have seating for the adjoining room available, yet.  Good thing is that they have doors on both sides, so even with the narrow walkway in front of the counter, people can shuffle in and out of the store easily.  

Late night hours is a big plus, which I read online as:
Sunday-Thursday 10 a.m. - 11 p.m.
Friday-Saturday until midnight.
author: CE Y.

description: I love how they give a reasonable ammount of frozen yogurt and unlimted toppings.
author: M L.

description:
This is a great place for an occassional (expersive) snack. They have lots of frozen yogurt options, which tricks you into thinking that the delicious sweets you are consuming are relatively healthy (but not absolutely).

This location has great customer service. I would recommend it to anyone.
author: Jennifer C.

description: It's busy! Long line... The fruit toppings look fresh! Taste Great! What a  place! Little pricey for what you get but ok.
author: Carlo K.

description: Great yogurt and great service! There is choice of flavorers of yogurt and a lot of toppings!
author: Rachel S.

description:
When I saw this on a Yelp search for fro-yo downtown, my reaction was literally "OMG PINKBERRY." I've only had it once before, a few years ago on a trip to New York and honestly I'm not really a big fro-yo person so I kind of didn't understand the hype. But comparing Pinkberry to some of the other fro-yo places I've been in the past - TCBY, I'm looking at you - even if it's not self-serve, reminds me of how awesome it really is.

It did take us about ten minutes to find it, because for some reason we thought it might be in the basement level. But nope, its entrance is out on OFarrell like one reviewer said - thank goodness for that reviewer, otherwise I would have been so sad.

I definitely recommend the plain tart. It does have sugar, but not very much and you can taste the tangy yogurt flavor so you know it's not just frozen whey juice. Also, they don't use high-fructose corn syrup in their yogurt mixes. Staff was really nice, helpful, and talkative just the right amount.
author: Amanda P.

description:
The yogurt at Pinkberry deserves 5 stars for sure.  Compared to the DIY yogurt joints where the yogurt tends to be overly-watery, PB's yogurt is thick and creamy!  There tend to be half a dozen flavors (some for a limited time) such as original, mango, watermelon, chocolate, peanut butter.  I usually sample one of the featured flavors but almost always go back to the original, which is simple and refreshing.

The prices are a little steep for the quantity that you get.  PB is a far cry from a value.  It's nearly $5 bucks for a small with toppings.  You choose your cup size, choose your yogurt flavor, and choose toppings or no toppings.  Pricing is based on size and topping vs. no topping.

Another gripe: the store is very cramped and there is very little seating inside, basically a small counter in the front window.  I was here on an overcast Tuesday evening, so I imagine that I would avoid this place like a plague on a hot weekend day...this place would be mad busy!!

I'd recommend grabbing your yogurt to-go and hiking a block up to sit at Union Square or a block down to sit at the cool, new sidewalk bench and table installation in front of H&M and Walgreens.

Overall, the yogurt is the best part of PB.  Everything else about the experience such as pricing and ambiance leaves a lot to be desired.
author: Matt S.

description:
JOSE is the man.

As with all of my Pinkberry reviews, the same thing applies: great chocolate hazelnut fro yo, and I LOVE the organic gummi bears. My only beef is that they never give you enough. Welllllll, I stand corrected. Upon sharing my grief with Jose, who serving up my Pinkberry, he went ahead and FILLED my cup to the absolute MAX with gummi bears, so high, I had to tell him he could go ahead and stop. 

This may seem trivial to some, stupid to many, and ridiculous to most, but to me, this made my night.
author: Katie K.

description: Thank you Pinkberry Santa! I have been a good girl all these years and this is exactly what I've been wishing for all this time!
author: Taffany H.

description: I used to not like PinkBerry at all - but then they created Chocolate Hazelnut. The perfect combination of delicious, creamy, and flavorful. As an ice cream lover, froyo is nasty to me, but for some reason this flavor is so seductive, it convinces my mind that it's actually ice cream. The other flavors are just ok to me. But as long as they have Chocolate Hazelnut, I'll keep coming back.
author: Sandy T.

description:
So this just moved in next to my work, and before it even showed up I knew it could be deadly for me.

Fortunately, it's too expensive for me to go more than once a month (even with a discount). And honestly, it's scary--I walk in and there's far too many employees behind the counter talking to me at once. 

It all tastes good though. I'm glad it will be there whenever I need a froyo fix.
author: Raquel R.

description:
What's not to like about this place? The froyo is consistently delicious, and always served at the right temperature! Prices are very good, and the store just looks clean overall. I always get their original tart because it's delicious--probably the best original tart of any froyo place out there (and I've been to a lot of froyo places)! 

My one complaint is the lack of usage bar area they have. They only set up the outdoor tables and chairs, and completely neglected setting up stools for those who want to sit inside.
author: Kevin D.

description:
You know, when the hare is beating the tortoise he just took a nap thinking he ha plenty of time.

Pinkberry is like the Hare.  don't get me wrong, they will still make tons of money in Union Square.  The multitudes of local youngin's  and tourists will supply the fuel for the Fro-Yo monster.  They could have done so much more if they had opened a NorCal (Frisco location) 8+ years ago!

I will humbly admit that part of it is a pride thing.  With a lot of the goodies going to LA first it just doesn't sit well with me that we had to wait nearly a decade to get one up here.  

Either way, the Fro-yo is still one of the best.  It's perfect balance of tartness, flavors and consistency is just right.  

It's just a shame that I will not be frequenting there because I've gotten the 'fro-yo is like crack good' out of my system nearly 8 years ago.

Thanks for nothing Pinkberry people.  Now, good day!

4stars for awesome fro-yo
-1 star for being that pretentious guy at the party who shows up right before the end.

3 Stars total
author: Anthony L.

description: Yummy! If you're in the Union Square area and want frozen yogurt, Pinkberry always hits the spot! Their yogurt is creamy and never icy, the fruits are fresh, and the employees are superduper friendly! Their prices aren't too bad either at around $3-4 for a small cup. They also have seasonal flavors such as pomegranate and passion fruit, which is always nice!
author: Joyce E.

description: Pinkberry is back. In SF, nonetheless. And a location that is not in SFO -- double like. Yes, it's still overpriced, but there's more flavors, and I still think it is amongst the best of the best in terms of frozen yogurt. Yum.
author: Mel G.

description: Finally got to try Pinkberry in CA. This location is crowded but I found a table quickly. Touristy but fun.
author: Virginia M.

description: Hhmm where do I start? If I could give half star I would. There are tons of good yogurt places in San Francisco, this one should have stayed in San Jose. Overpriced and awful service, and yes I'm referring to one particular person (JOSE, yes, you!!!). Learn how to listen before you start making faces, waving your hands and shaking your head at your customer when they try to tell you what kind of toping they want. And say sorry and try to throw your smile afterwards just prove that you're quilty. This might sound like a personal venting but I'm hoping whoever the store manager is will read this.
author: Lovetoeat A.

description:
I love this place! I go here at least once a week to satisfy my sweet tooth. Perfect location - right near Union Square, BART, and several muni lines. Very accessible! That's a plus. The team members are very welcoming and always have smiles. In fact, most of them, know me by name with the exception of the recent new hires who are probably college students from nearby universities I enjoy that they rotate flavors from time to time, as it allows me to indulge into a fantasy of froyo and limitless flavors and combinations. You can get a small with toppings for under five bucks because there is no tax on the froyo! YAY!!! 

Contrary to what that blasphemous she-devil "Bonnie Z." said, it is not over five bucks because they don't charge tax. Either she is a hideous liar or she just can't accept the fact that Pinkberry has their ish down, baby girl. 

You must try the chocolate chip cookie dough topping! Mmmm yum! I love chocolate hazlenut froyo with marshmallow, cookie dough, sugarpova, m&m's, and oreo! 
(LOOK AT ALL THOSE TOPPINGS FOR UNDER 5 BUCKS!!!!! WOWWW!!!!)

BTDUBS, conveniently next door to Macy's. Cologne section. Smellin' gewdddddd and eatin' gewdddddd.
author: Matt M.

description: The mango flavor hits the spot nicely! I got mango and mochi in a waffle cone. I think I prefer having froyo in a cup though. Affordable frozen yogurt that makes your taste buds tingle and chill.
author: Joanne K.

description:
This is my favorite Froyo place. I need to have this when I want something sweet to eat. It is my go to spot if I want any cold delicious yogurt.

Anyways this place has really great customer service. The employees are really friendly and nice. What I also like about this place is how smooth tasting the yogurt is. The worker that helped me - I forgot her name but she made my cup look really nice and not messy. I usually like it if I create my own froyo and HATE when other places like Tuttimelon or Loveberry do it for you because they make it so sloppy and sometimes give you way too little toppings. This girl who helped me knew the just right amount to give - not too much or not too small. 

It's a bit on the pricer side but definitely worth it.
author: David C.

description: As our office manager I take my co-workers to this Pinkberry occasionally and the service is always great!  We roll up with 10-15 people and we are always out in a jiffy.   Plus the fro-yo is AMAZING and the topping are fresh.
author: Windy M.

description: Hands down my favorite fro-yo ever! My favorite flavors are mango, pomegranate & original. The place is too small and it gets really crowded and long line on a nice warm day. But it's worth the wait. The staffs are very friendly.
author: Jingle A.

description:
I moved from NYC two years ago and had been in withdrawal ever since. Thank GOD They finally opened one here! 

Tart and refreshing without sugar overload unless you pick sugary toppings, this is the best snack or dessert.

I love the Mochi topping and green tea powder!  I just got two take home pints of original and watermelon (yuuuum) with a load of toppings. Also bought the cute bag that came with!!

This shop is clean, bustling and swift! The staff is sweet and super friendly. I live 5 blocks away, so this is a dream come true.
author: Annie W.

description:
Doesn't disappoint. When it comes to frozen yogurt, there's the yogurt-yogurt school or the wannabe-ice-cream school (TCBY on the west coast or tasti d-lite back east). You know what you like. If you like frozen yogurt that tastes like yogurt, only frozen, then pinkberry is a very safe bet. 

The staff at this location was friendly, the shop itself seemed clean if nondescript (are any pinkberry locations particularly memorable? I guess you go for the yogurt, not the surroundings.) Service seemed a little on the slow side, but it could just have been that the people in front of me in line were really indecisive about their toppings.

I ordered plain yogurt with blueberries and strawberries but got talked into getting mango too. That was a mistake. The mango was completely unripe and tasted like sour shoe rubber. I ended up eating around it. However - 50% my own fault for not stearing clear of mango in December. 50% pinkberry's fault for stocking unripe, non-local fruit.
author: Jessie P.

description: My 1st time ever at a pinkberry and I wasn't too impressed. Tasted no different from other frozen yogurt places but I guess all the rest copied pinkberry right? I got a mini with mango and original with toppings and I think it was around $4 soo expensive for a few bites. But I do like that you can put as much toppings as you want and the best topping, Almond Rocha!! yum
author: Karen T.

description: This was my first time trying Pinkberry... It was tasty but I think I prefer places like Red Mango, where I can serve myself. The coconut and cherry yogurts were both good as was the mochi topping!
author: Kae H.

description:
Small mango with almonds, raspberries, gummy fruit, 1 chocolate pretzel - amazing

Probably go there at least twice a week
author: Sunny M.

description:
Had my first taste of Pinkberry fro yo yesterday at the premiere and it was pretty good stuff.

sample #1...mango (sans topping)...4 stars...VERY good flavor...doesn't need any topping

sample #2...watermelon (sans topping)...3 stars...just okay...very subtle flavor...doesn't taste very much like watermelon (my subjective opinion)...would try again, but with a topping

sample #3...plain/tart with a few cubes of mango on top and a waffle cookie on the side...WINNER!...5 stars...I will definitely be back for the tart yogurt...it was fab all on its own, but the cubed mango tasted fairly fresh and ripe and it's hard to go wrong when a fresh, ripe mango is involved

Synopsis...definitely a fan of the tart/original flavor and I would be happy to have that everyday, without any toppings...it's just that good...also wouldn't hesitate to have the mango again

Why only 4 stars?

I didn't have to pay for any of this...it was all gratis. I may raise/lower the rating later on, it will depend on how I feel when I see their pricing.

As for the event...it was really fun and exciting at 5 PM, They rolled out the PINK (okay, it was really fuchsia) carpet...had a fun, upbeat DJ playing event appropriate music and they were giving out free samples of all their yogurt to those who were standing around and waiting in what was a very long line. I might have been a little less excited if I had to wait in line but, to be completely honest, I was brought to the front of the line...in front of all the mobile media peeps from twitter, facebook, et al...it was FREE and INSTANT gratification at its best. Even so, I will be back again, today, and I might even wait in line and pay this time.
author: Rue L.

description:
The first Pinkberry I've been to. I came in about 45 minutes after they opened on a Monday morning. The flavors of the day were:

-Mango
-Chocolate Hazelnut (Very sweet, creamy)
-Peanut butter
-Pomegranate
-Lychee (Sweet, lightly tart; clean, refreshing, fruity)
-Original (Very similar to lychee, but less tart, kind of flat)

The one staff member there was very attentive, but then again, I was the only customer. She offered me samples of four of the flavors. The only memorable one was the lychee, which I ordered. I wasn't in the mood for something super sweet, and the lychee fro-yo was just what my taste buds were looking for. I ordered a small cup with blueberries, strawberries, and mochi for texture. The fruit was firm and juicy and went great with the mild tartness of the yogurt. An excellent pre-noon snack.
author: Andrew P.

description:
Came here with friends and there was only a few other people in the store with us. It was somewhat noisy, but the workers were pretty friendly. I got the mango yogurt and it was heaven! I tried their peanut butter and it tasted more closely to peanut sauce Thai cuisines use (but still good). The server gave me a generous amount, but the rest of my friends did not get so much.

minus 1 star for the lack of space to sit and enjoy and forced to go outside in busy downtown to eat it all. Also, the cashier was not really friendly-- she never once made  eye contact with me the whole time.
author: Karina N.

description:
I came here during their "soft opening," as one of the employees called it. It was the day when they went all out and pink-ified neighboring trash cans and plant holders. They had a huge tent with a (really good) DJ spinning tracks from 5PM to, what I presume, 10PM, which is when the free froyo event ended. 

I waited in line for about thirty minutes, and the employees were nice enough to entertain us while we waited. Menus were being passed around, and I was somewhat overwhelmed with all the toppings, NOT with the froyo flavors. I like how they handed out little sample cups (that were pretty generous, in my opinion), of every flavor. I had peanut butter and watermelon.

Even though the wait was long, it was FREE. I couldn't complain! 

Anyways, I decided to get mango froyo, because every other flavor I've tried, or is standard (like strawberry, chocolate, and original/tart). As long as the toppings fit, I could have chosen what I wanted.

So, I asked for cheesecake bits, which they didn't have, but I swear that they had a little container hanging out on the edge of the toppings with cheesecake bits in it, but I didn't press the point. 

I ended up choosing mochi, watermelon, and cap'n crunch, along with a waffle cookie. I loved the waffle cookie! It was a nice touch that I haven't seen anywhere else.

I went outside, where there were tables set up underneath the large tent (which extended off the sidewalk), and ate.

The mango froyo was good - somewhat tart, somewhat sweet. It had a small hint of mango flavor, which was nice. The watermelon wasn't very flavorful, which disappointed me. Mochi is always good; I loveeeee mochi. And cap'n crunch added an extra sweetness that was nice. 

I still wish that I could have had cheesecake bits, but it's alright! Maybe the next time I go, I'll get cheesecake and brownie bits. Yum. 

Very very good impression for my first Pinkberry experience, and I'll definitely be back sometime soon.
author: Nancy C.

description: Pinkberry has really flavorful.. er.. flavors. Of froyo, that is. But it is on the expensive side, running about $3.50 for a small cup with no toppings. However, it is worth the indulgence every once in a while. They have both tart and sweet flavors. I love the combo of pomegranate and chocolate hazelnut. Yum!
author: Karen C.

description:
I really do not like that it is not a self serve. I gave this place another chance because I love the chocolate crispies. By the time she was done swirling my yogurt and put toppings (no cheesecake bits, wth) it was already melting. The lady needs to learn her swirling techniques, the presentation was terrible and she didnt even spead the toppings evenly. 
I will not be going here again a huge disappointment.
I'm like my self serve at Yogurtland with Sanrio spoons!
author: Juk M.

description: After hearing everyone getting excited over this opening, I got a little excited too. Unfortunately, the service does not compare to other Pinkberrys I've been to in the past. The line formation was not clear in this small space and no staff showed acknowledgement of your presence. My situation worsened when one staff spent a lot of time with the customer before me, answering her every request and covering more frozen yogurt surface space when she asked him to. Then I was skipped entirely by another staffer who asked for the order of the person behind me. The frozen yogurt I was given also had a large hollow hole in the center. My wafer was broken the first time, which the staffer sentenced to the trash, which I would've been fine with. If it were self serve, people can be responsible for their own quanities and toppings. There are just so many frozen yogurt places to choose from nowadays with the DIY model.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
If I wanted to hear about how you're getting rid of yogurt chips and replacing them with white chocolate crisp pieces, I would have asked. 

Yogurt sucks and is overpriced. 

One star for the nice girl who served me..... she must have the patience of a saint to deal with the mouthy dude that works there. 

Seriously bro, please stop talking to me about the rules for putting toppings on the yogurt.
author: Jill L.

description: I wish there was one nearby. I had the chocolate hazelnut (it's made with real nutella!) It was THEE best frozen yogurt. I would make the drive up to the city or to Stanford.
author: claire m.

description: Did not like this location. I already have mixed feelings on Pinkberry since I like yogurt shops where you can do all the toppings yourself. The kid working here was rude and had no clue what he was doing. Also, they don't have chairs inside where you  could potentially sit and enjoy your yogurt....but they do have some outside.... Strange
author: Anastasia B.

description: Pinkberry creates frozen yogurt good enough to knock out its tacky and much processed yogurt making competitors! Its yogurt is not only rich and creamy, it's not too sweet and syrupy. Does not melt into a liquid mess. I ordered the mango mochi topping on top of pomegranate and greek froyo and was not disappointed. You get what you pay for. Cannot remember if they were organic, but Pinkberry, two thumbs up!
author: Roanna L.

description: The asian girl, i think her name is Gina.. She is very rude and no idea what  customer service is.  I was greeted the moment i stepped in, which is great (greeted by a different employee). Then Gina asked me for my order, i replied in a nice way, i need some time and ill let you know. After a minute she came back to me asking for my order again in a kind rude voice, i replied, i havent decided yet and for the third time she asked me for my order very rude as if im wasting her time. The store wasnt busy at all so no need to rush. Because of her rudeness, i walked out of the store.
author: Ar L.

author: Mat C.

description:
Why?

Are you serious?

Why couldn't you just stay in L.A.

When I was growing up we had one frozen yogurt place, no frills, but many flavors called Golden Spoon.  And it was good, nothing spectacular.

This place is exactly the same.  Exotic flavors, all this hipster crap.  Stupid toppings.  All overpriced for no good reason.

It's frozen yogurt.  Let's strip down the reality of this.  Breathe in.  Breathe out.

Oh my word it's just overpriced frozen yogurt.

Keep thinking you're reducing your calories and eating healthy, because the reality is you're not.

I am looking forward for this hype dying out completely.

I added a star because at least its clean.  Some froyo places are absolutely nasty.
author: Adrian E.

description: At the heart of San Francisco, this is a great spot to get frozen yogurt. The quality of the yogurt is richer than most of the yogurt places around (even though Pinkberry is a chain). The selection of toppings is overwhelming at times. There's just TOO MANY choices! Pinkberry is also good at switching out the flavors of yogurt so you're not stuck choosing from the same flavors all the time. Though I do enjoy the grapefruit and green tea froyo, there is nothing like the richness of the original tart yogurt. The staff here is friendly and they do give generous portions of both toppings and frozen yogurt. The only downside is that there isn't a lot of seating space. There's a couple of seats inside and a couple of chairs and tables outside. Other than that, this place is a definite must to fulfill your froyo needs. Also, if you're a frequent froyo connoisseur, get their store card to earn points every time you buy something from there. You'll get one point per order and a free frozen yogurt once you earn 10 points.
author: Lisa H.

description: I was a little nonplussed when I heard Pinkberry was coming to town, and I didn't quite understand the O'Farrell location but when I was sweltering in Macy's today, it suddenly sounded like a pretty good idea.  The staff was just a tad bit too perky and there was too many choices, so I opted for one straight from the poster on the wall:  chocolate, hazelnut with a drizzle of syrup. I am proud to say I resisted and got the really small size -- but have to admit I went back for a second one just a few hours later.  As long as I keep my little shift in the shoe salon, Pinkberry's may be my go to spot.
author: Robert M.

description: Pinkberry makes me happy and their original tart never fails! But please bring back coconut -- it should be a permanent flavor!
author: Lana L.

description: This review is for the customer service not the yogurt. I have never had a bad experience at pinkberry until today. I know all the staff and this staff member named LETI helped me for the first time . She was really rude not smiling and completely rushed my order I could tell my yogurt was under it was a smaller portion than the norm ! She re weighed it and look confused and then just asked me what toppings I wanted. When she rang me out she completely rushed the transaction and was rude! Why do you work here if it's obvious you don't like your job or being nice to people ??? Next time I come in and she helps me I rather be skipped
author: Lisa N.

description: Let me preface by saying, coconut is my favorite flavor.  When they have it I love this place, but when they don't it becomes somewhat difficult to choose.  I've been here a few times and I've ventured into a few flavors, such as Mango and Pomegranate, but Coconut is my go to choice.  I prefer the more tart flavors than the sweet, just my preference, but I've enjoyed most of the flavors here.  As for the toppings they have a good variety and you can pretty much "fill the cup" with up to 5 toppings.  My usual choices involve fruit, almonds, coconut flakes, mochi.  I usually go if I'm in the area.  The biggest downfall is probably paying $6 for a medium with toppings.  That seems pricy, but that's just me.  Also they are doing away with the stamp cards, and are starting to use an App, but if you download the app and get a card you get a free small with toppings, so there's that.
author: Jeremaine R.

description: I love pinkberry, but my pomegranate seeds were a little mushy, so I'm withholding the 5th star.
author: Sarah W.

description: I am highly disappointed in their catering customer service.  I have ordered in the past for birthday parties.  Since there wasn't one in SF in the past, I believe I dealt with either SFO or Palo Alto.  They had exceptional customer service and were very informed.  Sadly, SF is lacking that.  I asked for all the information in regards to ordering a drop off catering for August (I emailed them back in June. I like to plan ahead and be thorough).  They gave me the prices, options, and advised me the cost of delivery.  (Which went up.  SFO or PA used to charge $15, but I'm not complaining).  Mind you, this is a small child's birthday party.  After having to constantly ask if the flavors were the same as they kept changing it (they never went out of their way to advise me of the flavor changes time to time like they said they would), I finally decided not to ask until the week of the event.  One time it took them an entire weekend to reply back to my email.  I had to resend it again.  Anyway, I finally go to inform them what I would like to order.  At that point (not 2 months ago or a few weeks ago... Literally THREE days before the event), finally decided to tell me there's a $100 minimum to order delivery.  What the hell am I supposed to do with $100 worth of frozen yogurt?  I do not need to fill these kids up with all that sugar.  Why couldn't they have told me this a  long time ago?  Why just now?  Screw that.  I'm pissed off that I have to deal with these people who just now decided to add that bit of information.  No thank you.  At this point, I will happily order from else where and give them my business and recommendations when it comes to catering, even if I have to pay a bit more.  It's the principle.  I'm highly disappointed at these people and their customer service and lack of common sense when it comes to timing.  If you want to get catering from pinkberry, make sure it's not from the SF location.  They could really care less about your event.
author: R. A. D.

description: Tasty and reasonably priced. It makes my boss happy, and that makes my day better. They even put a bag of ice in the to go bag to keep the Froyo from melting on the way back to the office.
author: Brian D.

description: So my friend's fiance said we HAD to go there cuz it's the BEST. Of course, I'm down for trying it out. I got salted caramel with no toppings- wanted to see how the yogurt stood alone (like the cheese, get it? The farmer in the Dell, the cheese stands alone?) Anyway, it was pretty delicious. I also loved the way they placed the toppings on my friends orders- very artful, not just dumping a spoonful of m&m's on there- no, none of that. I appreciate aesthetics, cuz I'm an artist and all. Go, enjoy. A little pricey, hence 4 instead of 5, also because you can only sit outside.TIP* park in the o'Farell (can't spell) garage, esp. at night. 6-midnight it only costs ONE DOLLA, and PB is right across the street.
author: Nina N.

description: First time ever and loved it!! I got a mixture of strawberry and tart frozen yogurt. For toppings, I chose granola, blueberries, and mango. If you couldn't tell, I really love my fruits! The people working were so sweet and personable. They were very enthusiastic about serving frozen yogurt, which made my whole experience even better! I cannot wait to devour a Pinkberry again!
author: Surge C.

description: We all know what froyo tastes like, so I'm not going to mention that. I would, however, like to say that this store does an excellent job moving customers through the line - a necessity for a joint so close to Union Square.
author: Kate B.

description: Pinkberry in the city? About time! Always have been a fan of Pinkberry and I'm glad they're here now. I love their location, right next to the parking garage. So grab a cup on your way back to your car or on your way to go shopping around union square.
author: Chris T.

description: Why is the ORIGINAL PINKBERRY so good!!??  Why are the portions so overpriced??!!  First world problems for sure.
author: Jeff P.

description: I went here Mon-Thurs for a month straight.  Never got old and never strayed from my order: Medium Hazelnut, Peanut Butter and Pomegranate side by side with strawberries, rasberries, mochi, pomegranate pieces if available, and a random dry topping.  I could not get enough and I never will.  The people that work here are really sweet. I also love that they will put it in a bag with ice for later.  I'm an avid FroYo fanatic and this place is a fave. Love it!
author: Lindsay C.

description: Just what you need after a long day of shopping.  Pinkberry in the middle of union square.  The place I judge all other froyo places by.  Always has fresh fruit and a variety of different flavors... but I aways end up with the original tart.
author: Sam C.

description: Great froyo at a great price. For being a large chain, their froyo is still pretty rich and creamy. Not to sweet, and nice assortment of flavors. They're also pretty generous with their toppings, and the people who work there are really nice. I ordered a small and the person making my froyo was able to fit 4-5 toppings, plus a waffle cookie on top. Love this place!
author: Rhea K.

description:
chocolate + peanut butter = amazing. 

the staff are always friendly and i have to give them major props - when I took my froyo to go they put a bag of ice in my bag so that it wouldn't melt on my way up the hill. i mean, who thinks to do that? the extra gesture was amazing!
author: laura f.

description: So glad there is FINALLY a Pinkberry in San Francisco. All the Pinkberry's are pretty much the same so no sense in writing a full review. For those who have never eaten at a Pinkberry get up right now and do something about it!
author: Andrew M.

description: The frozen yogurt is as refreshing as the names and the descriptions on the walls of the Pinkberry. We loved every bit of it especially with the chunks of almond roca placed at the bottom of the waffle cone. We can't wait to return again, :-)
author: Mia B.

description: Yipee! So glad to have a Pinkberry in SF do I can get my fix. My absolute favorite yogurt spot. I love those dark chocolate crispies!!!
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
i've been pining for a San Francisco Pinkberry location for a long time, and I'm happy that it's finally here! 

I've had many of the frozen yogurt places in San Francisco, and most were disappointing, with the exceptional Yoppi Yogurt that closely matches the quality of what Pinkberry is known for. 

One of my co-worker/friend has said that Pinkberry is known to have a tarter as well as a smoother textured yogurt (soft serve life). I also like Yoppi Yogurt's texture, as it resembles soft serve and is not watery like other frozen yogurt places in town (that I will not name). 

Pinkberry is however more costly then other frozen yogurt places - where price is based on cup size, but at a premium price, you are granted unlimited toppings.

I tried their watermelon (which was refreshing with tartness) and their peanut butter (it was rich in peanut butter flavor). I know that the combination might sound odd and that the actual fruit and nut are not a match made in heaven, but flavor wise, it actually worked. I wish there were flavors like red velvet, taro, or even other cake batter flavors (which I suppose is fine, because if all frozen yogurt places carried the same flavor, it's not original in the long run). 

I also want Red Mango to come to San Francisco (bah, I ain't going all the way to Emeryville just for frozen yogurt). Pinkberry is fine with me!
author: Alex C.

description: I loooove froyo and i looove pinkberry. 5 stars for the excellent customer service the guy helping me gave and also for their yummy chocolate hazelnut flavor. i asked for a sample.. and my sample was a good portion to sample the flavor! I'll be back soon for sure!
author: Mertani G.

description:
The frozen yogurt in pinkberry is the best frozen yogurt that I ever have in the US. I tried several frozen yogurt before like red mango, yogurt land.... Etc. But the pinkberry is the best one and it has a lots of different flavor. I love the original flavor because it taste sour and
A little bit sweet. U should have a cup of yogurt when u go to downtown.
author: Kelly Y.

description: My favorite frozen yogurt place!!!!
author: Julie K.

description: It is right next to Macy's in Union Square. The line can get really long on the weekends.  It is in a great location, perfect stop for in between shopping. The toppings are fresh and the yogurt is soft and delicious. The service is good too. However the only disappointment is the small amount of yogurt and toppings they give you compared to other Pink Berrys and Friache.
author: Ka L.

description:
I have been waiting for Pinkberry to come to SF for four long years. I was thrilled that it opened in the airport - and then devastated to learn that it was impossible for a non-ticket holder to access. I was drawn in by the "countdown to swirling," which promised a Berkeley location last April, and then disappeared when the counter got to zero. Needless to say, I jumped for joy when I heard that Pinkberry was FINALLY coming to San Francisco. 

Despite all this, and the fact that Pinkberry is probably the most delicious thing in the whole world, this location is HORRIBLE. Horrible. Between the traffic and the tourists, the location has to be the worst in the city. I am so disappointed.

Pinkberry owner, if you can hear me, open somewhere else in San Francisco!!! I will be your best customer.
author: Kristen R.

description: After being around cranky transit workers, crazy fast pedestrians, and the chaotic bustle of the big city, we were amazed at the friendly and fast service here! The workers were smiling and didn't seem rushed at all. There was a line, but we were still offered samples before we made our choice. And everyone was served pretty swiftly. We went with the strawberry banana yogurt with fresh fruit toppings. The tub was packed full so we had a lot to enjoy!
author: Ruthie R.

description: my go-to for fro-yo ~ ive loved this place since they first opened up back at my hometown and was so glad to know that they followed me here to SF :)
author: Lena E.

description: The best froyo I've ever had!!! This was the first time I've had Pinkberry, so I decided to try the majority of them! Must say that the watermelon and the strawberry taste the same to me, the chocolate didn't taste any different than the other froyos, BBBUUUTT  the Mango was bomb!  At other froyo places, the mango tasted sour and expired lol..... I had mochi, chocolate sprinkles, and mixed nuts with my froyo and it was delicious! The lady that was helping me was just the sweetest, and even though the line was out the door I didn't feel rushed! Though this was my first time, I think that I'll have Pinkberry cravings... So will be back for more of course!
author: Melanie S.

description: pinkberry is awesome better than yogurtland. but it all depends if you like to pick the ingredients up yourself and place them into your cup
author: Eugene H.

description: LOVE Pinkberry. Also left my wallet there yesterday, Saturday Nobember 3,2012 @ around 4:30pm. Returned an hour later and the employess gave it back to me Cash, Credit cards, ID, everything in tact. Awesome yogurt and Management obviously does a great job hiring GREAT people. Can't thank you enough!
author: Lisa H.

description: hey pinkberry, please train your employees on how to make the smoothies on your menu BEFORE you open up for business. i had to wait 10-15 minutes for my green tea smoothie. after i waited for a while, the employee asked me to do a "taste test" to tell him if it was okay or not. i appreciated his concern about that so i'll give him that. i looked at it questioningly because it was pure liquid. i took a sip and immediately handed it back to him and asked him to make a new one for me. i was a little grossed out (and at the same time amused) when, without hesitation, he took a drink out of my straw after i gave the drink back to see how bad it was. he made me a new one and it turned out a lot better although it still wasn't quite the right consistency yet. this review will definitely change once this pinkberry store easily solves this problem by making the employees better prepared for more than just pulling a lever to put froyo in a cup.
author: Stephanie C.
